cars.title: Toyota GR Supra
cars.description: The Toyota GR Supra (model code J29/DB or A90/A91 for marketing purposes) is a sports car produced by Toyota since 2019.

cars.title: Lamborghini Murciélago
cars.description: The Lamborghini Murciélago is a sports car produced by Italian automotive manufacturer Lamborghini between 2001[9] and 2010. Successor to the Diablo and flagship V12 of the automaker's lineup, the Murciélago was introduced as a coupé in 2001.

cars.title: Audi R8
cars.description: The Audi R8 is a mid-engine, 2-seater sports car, which uses Audi's trademark quattro permanent all-wheel drive system. It was introduced by the German car manufacturer Audi AG in 2006. Production ended in the first quarter of 2024.

cars.title: Bugatti Chiron
cars.description: The Bugatti Chiron is a mid-engine two-seater sports car designed and developed in Germany by Bugatti Engineering GmbH and manufactured in Molsheim, France, by French automobile manufacturer Bugatti Automobiles S.A.S.

cars.title: Chevrolet Camaro
cars.description: The Chevrolet Camaro is a mid-size American automobile manufactured by Chevrolet, classified as a pony car.

cars.title: Rolls-Royce Ghost
cars.description: The Rolls-Royce Ghost is a full-sized luxury car manufactured by Rolls-Royce Motor Cars. It was designed as a smaller, more measured, more realistic car than the Phantom, aiming for a lower price category for Rolls-Royce models.

cars.title: Bentley Continental GT
cars.description: The Bentley Continental GT is a grand touring car manufactured and marketed by the British company Bentley Motors since 2003.

cars.title: Porsche 918 Spyder
cars.description: The Porsche 918 Spyder is a high performance sports car manufactured by German marque Porsche.

cars.title: BMW 2 Series (G42)
cars.description: The BMW 2 Series (G42) is the second generation of the BMW 2 Series subcompact executive coupé, the successor in 2021 to the F22 2 Series coupé and convertible.

cars.title: Ferrari F40
cars.description: The Ferrari F40 (Type F120) is a mid-engine, rear-wheel drive sports car[12] engineered by Nicola Materazzi with styling by Pininfarina.
